revision.text: DNA microarray Moran G, Stokes C, Thewes S, Hube B, Coleman DC, Sullivan D (2004). "Comparative genomics using Candida albicans DNA microarrays reveals absence and divergence of virulence-associated genes in Candida dubliniensis". Microbiology 150: 3363-3382. doi:10.1099/mic.0.27221-0. PMID 15470115 A DNA-microarray is a microarray that is used as a physical 2D immobilisation matrix for DNA sequences. DNA microarray-bound DNA fragments are used as targets for a hybridising probed sample. PERSON: Daniel Schober PERSON: Frank Gibson DNA Chip DNA-array Web:<http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DNA_microarray>@2008/03/03 is a subclass from microarray
